ground_truth: She turns toward him and undoes her hair, which falls around her shoulders. Fergus runs his hand down her throat, and she draws him behind a curtain toward the bed, pulling him down as they kiss passionately. She then walks into the bathroom, and Fergus lies there, looking at the picture and listening to the sound of running water. She comes out dressed in a silk kimono, looking extraordinarily beautiful, and he draws her toward him, beginning to kiss her face and neck. She murmurs no as his hands slip the wrap down from her shoulders, then stop. The kimono falls to the floor gently, with a whisper, and the camera travels with it, revealing in a close-up that she is a man. Fergus sits there, frozen, staring at her, saying nothing. She gives a strange little laugh and reaches out to touch him, but he smacks her hand away, gets up, and runs to the bathroom. She grabs his feet, but he kicks her away, runs into the bathroom, and vomits into the tub. She lights a cigarette as Fergus slams the door shut. She sits on the couch, the kimono round her once more, looking very much like a woman, with a trace of blood on her mouth. Fergus comes out of the bathroom, and she looks up, some hope in her face, as he makes to go. She grabs him to stop him, but he pulls away, and she falls to the floor. Fergus sits as Col turns to him, and he touches her arm, but she whips her arm away and walks into the crowd, toward the door. Fergus leaves and walks outside Dil's place, where the blinds in her room are down, and the light is on inside. We see her outline, pacing up and down behind the blinds, smoking a cigarette. A man removes a large number six from a huge scoreboard with a pole and replaces it with a number nine. Below the scoreboard, we see Dil walking across a lawn toward the building where Fergus is working. Fergus is fitting a new window into the finished wall, and on the pitch, we see cricketers distorted through the moving glass of the window. Across the pitch, Dil walks with a lunch basket in her hand, dressed in a very short skirt with high heels. As she approaches the site, a chorus of whistles breaks out. Fergus, hearing the whistling, stares out and sees Dil moving toward the site. He drops the window, and the glass shatters. As the whistles continue, we see Dil in the site's lift, which rises up. Meanwhile, we see Deveroux and Franknum climbing up a ladder toward Fergus, and through this conversation, Fergus can hear the chorus of wolf whistles increasing.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: She turns toward him and unfastens her hair, which cascades around her shoulders. Fergus runs his hand down her neck, and she draws him behind a veil toward the bed, pulling him down as they kiss fervently. She then walks into the lavatory, and Fergus lies there, gazing at the image and listening to the sound of running water. She comes out dressed in a silk robe, looking exceptionally gorgeous, and he draws her toward him, beginning to kiss her face and neck. She murmurs no as his hands slip the garment down from her shoulders, then stop. The robe falls to the floor gently, with a rustle, and the camera travels with it, revealing in a close-up that she is a man. Fergus sits there, motionless, staring at her, saying nothing. She gives a peculiar little laugh and reaches out to touch him, but he slaps her hand away, gets up, and runs to the lavatory. She grabs his feet, but he kicks her away, runs into the lavatory, and retches into the tub. She lights a cigarette as Fergus slams the door shut. She sits on the sofa, the robe around her once more, looking very much like a woman, with a trace of blood on her lips. Fergus comes out of the lavatory, and she looks up, some hope in her face, as he makes to go. She grabs him to stop him, but he pulls away, and she falls to the floor. Fergus sits as Col turns to him, and he touches her arm, but she jerks her arm away and walks into the throng, toward the door. Fergus leaves and walks outside Dil's place, where the shades in her room are down, and the light is on inside. We see her outline, pacing up and down behind the shades, smoking a cigarette. A man removes a large number six from a huge scoreboard with a pole and replaces it with a number nine. Below the scoreboard, we see Dil walking across a lawn toward the structure where Fergus is working. Fergus is fitting a new window into the completed wall, and on the field, we see cricketers distorted through the shifting glass of the window. Across the field, Dil walks with a meal basket in her hand, dressed in a very short skirt with high heels. As she approaches the site, a chorus of whistles erupts. Fergus, hearing the whistling, gazes out and sees Dil moving toward the site. He drops the window, and the glass shatters. As the whistles continue, we see Dil in the site's elevator, which ascends. Meanwhile, we see Deveroux and Franknum climbing up a ladder toward Fergus, and through this dialogue, Fergus can hear the chorus of wolf whistles intensifying.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: Toward him, she is turned and her hair is undone, causing it to fall around her shoulders. Down her throat, a hand is run by Fergus, and behind a curtain toward the bed, he is drawn by her, as he is pulled down and they kiss passionately. Into the bathroom, she then walks, and there lies Fergus, looking at the picture and listening to the sound of running water. Dressed in a silk kimono, she comes out and is looked at by him as extraordinarily beautiful, and toward him, she is drawn as her face and neck begin to be kissed by him. She murmurs no as the wrap is slipped down from her shoulders by his hands, then they stop. To the floor, the kimono falls gently, with a whisper, and with it, the camera travels, revealing in a close-up that a man is she. There sits Fergus, frozen, as at her he stares, saying nothing. A strange little laugh is given by her and she reaches out to touch him, but her hand is smacked away by him, and to the bathroom, he runs. His feet are grabbed by her, but she is kicked away by him, and into the bathroom, he runs, vomiting into the tub. A cigarette is lit by her as the door is slammed shut by Fergus. On the couch, she sits, with the kimono round her once more, looking very much like a woman, with a trace of blood on her mouth. From the bathroom comes Fergus, and to her, she looks up, some hope in her face, as he makes to go. To stop him, she grabs him, but away he pulls, and to the floor, she falls. Fergus sits as Col is turned to by her, and her arm is touched by him, but away she whips her arm and into the crowd, toward the door, she walks. Outside Dil's place, Fergus leaves and walks, where in her room, the blinds are down, and inside the light is on. Her outline is seen by us, pacing up and down behind the blinds, smoking a cigarette. A large number six is removed from a huge scoreboard with a pole by a man and with a number nine, it is replaced. Below the scoreboard, Dil is seen by us walking across a lawn toward the building where Fergus is working. A new window is being fitted by Fergus into the finished wall, and on the pitch, through the moving glass of the window, cricketers are seen distorted by us. Across the pitch, with a lunch basket in her hand, walks Dil, dressed in a very short skirt with high heels. As the site is approached by her, a chorus of whistles breaks out. Hearing the whistling, Fergus stares out and sees Dil moving toward the site. The window is dropped by him, and the glass shatters. As the whistles continue, in the site's lift, Dil is seen by us, which rises up. Meanwhile, Deveroux and Franknum are seen climbing up a ladder toward Fergus, and through this conversation, the chorus of wolf whistles increasing is heard by Fergus.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: She turns to him, undoes her hair, and pulls Fergus behind a curtain toward the bed as they kiss passionately. She enters the bathroom, while Fergus lies looking at a picture and listening to running water. She emerges in a silk kimono, appearing stunning, and he begins kissing her face and neck. She murmurs no as his hands slip her wrap, revealing she is a man. Fergus freezes, staring silently. She laughs strangely, reaching out, but he smacks her hand, rushes to the bathroom, and vomits. She lights a cigarette as Fergus slams the door. She sits on the couch, kimono wrapped, resembling a woman, with blood on her mouth. Fergus emerges; she looks hopeful, but he leaves. She grabs him, falls, and he sits while she walks to the door, leaving him. Fergus exits, seeing Dil's silhouette pacing and smoking behind blinds. A man changes a scoreboard number from six to nine. Dil walks toward Fergusâ€™s worksite with a lunch basket, in a short skirt and high heels, drawing whistles. Fergus, hearing them, sees her approach, drops a window, and it shatters. Dil rides up in a lift as Deveroux and Franknum climb a ladder to Fergus, amidst growing wolf whistles.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: She undoes her hair, and Fergus touches her throat. She leads him to the bed, and they kiss. She goes to the bathroom, and Fergus looks at a picture, listening to running water. She returns in a silk kimono, and he kisses her. She murmurs no as her kimono falls, revealing she is a man. Fergus freezes, then rejects her touch, runs to the bathroom, and vomits. She lights a cigarette as the door slams. Sitting on the couch, she resembles a woman with blood on her mouth. Fergus exits the bathroom, but she falls trying to stop him. Fergus leaves, touching her arm before she walks into the crowd. Outside Dil's place, Fergus sees her outline behind blinds. A man changes a scoreboard from six to nine. Dil walks across a lawn toward Fergus, carrying a lunch basket and wearing a short skirt. As she nears, whistles erupt. Fergus drops a window, shattering it, as Dil enters the lift. Deveroux and Franknum climb a ladder to Fergus, who hears increasing whistles.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: With a graceful turn, she faces him, her fingers working deftly to release her hair, letting it cascade down around her shoulders in a silken wave. Fergus, with a gentle touch, trails his hand down the curve of her throat, and she, in response, guides him with an eager hand behind a softly draped curtain leading toward the bed. There, she draws him down alongside her, their lips meeting in a passionate and fervent kiss. After a moment, she rises and makes her way into the bathroom, leaving Fergus lying there, contemplating the picture as he listens to the soothing sound of running water. Shortly after, she reappears, now adorned in a luxurious silk kimono, looking exceptionally beautiful. Fergus feels a magnetic pull towards her and begins to plant tender kisses on her face and neck. Softly murmuring her objections, she gently whispers no as his hands slide the wrap from her shoulders, only to pause. The kimono slips off and gently drapes onto the floor with a soft, whisper-like sound, and at this moment, the camera follows its descent, focusing closely to reveal the unexpected truthâ€”that she is, in fact, a man. Stunned into silence, Fergus remains seated, immobilized, his gaze fixed on her in disbelief, unable to utter a single word. She lets out a peculiar, almost nervous laugh and reaches out with a tentative hand to touch him, but he reacts sharply, slapping her hand away, before bolting upright and rushing to the bathroom. She grabs at his feet in a desperate attempt to hold him, but he kicks her away, making a frantic dash into the bathroom, where he succumbs to his emotions and vomits into the tub. As the door slams shut with finality, she lights a cigarette, sitting on the couch clad in her kimono once more, presenting a striking image of femininity despite the faint trace of blood that tinges her lips. When Fergus eventually emerges from the bathroom, she looks up from her spot on the couch, her face betraying a glimmer of hope as he makes to leave. Attempting to prevent his departure, she grabs at him in a plea, but he wrenches free, causing her to tumble to the ground. Fergus sits down as Col turns to him, but when he reaches to touch her arm, she swiftly pulls it away and, without another word, strides into the gathering crowd, making her way toward the door. Fergus exits as well, stepping outside the confines of Dil's place, where the blinds in her room remain drawn, yet a light burns brightly inside. From the street, we catch a glimpse of her silhouette as she paces back and forth behind the blinds, cigarette smoke curling in the air. Nearby, a man is seen removing a large number six from an enormous scoreboard with a long pole, replacing it with a number nine. Below this scene, Dil is visible strolling across a green lawn, heading towards the building where Fergus is engaged in his work. Busy with the task of fitting a new window into the freshly completed wall, Fergus glances out over the pitch, where cricketers appear distorted through the shifting reflections on the moving glass of the window. In the distance, Dil approaches, carrying a lunch basket and dressed strikingly in a very short skirt complemented by high heels. As she draws nearer to the construction site, a chorus of whistles erupts from those around. Hearing the commotion of whistles, Fergus looks out in surprise and sees Dil making her way toward the site. In his distraction, the window slips from his grasp, and the glass shatters onto the ground. The chorus of whistles grows louder, and we see Dil stepping into the site's lift, which begins to ascend. Meanwhile, Deveroux and Franknum are seen climbing a ladder towards Fergus, and amidst their conversation, the persistent chorus of wolf whistles fills the air, growing ever more resonant.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: With a graceful and fluid turn, she faces him directly, her fingers skillfully working to release her hair from its confines, allowing it to cascade down around her shoulders in a silken, flowing wave. Fergus, with an exceedingly gentle and tender touch, trails his hand down the elegant curve of her throat, and she, responding with eagerness, guides him with a willing hand behind a softly draped curtain that leads them toward the inviting bed. It is there that she draws him down alongside her, and their lips meet in a passionate and fervent kiss that seems to speak volumes. After a fleeting moment, she rises and makes her way into the bathroom, leaving Fergus lying there, absorbed in contemplation, as he listens to the soothing sound of running water coming from the other room. Shortly thereafter, she reappears, now adorned in a luxurious silk kimono, looking exceptionally beautiful and captivating. Fergus feels an irresistible, magnetic pull towards her and begins to plant tender kisses on her face and neck. Softly murmuring her objections, she gently whispers no as his hands slide the wrap from her shoulders, only to pause momentarily. The kimono slips off and gracefully drapes onto the floor with a soft, whisper-like sound, and at that moment, the camera follows its descent, focusing closely to reveal the unexpected and shocking truthâ€”that she is, in fact, a man. Stunned into complete silence, Fergus remains seated, immobilized, his gaze fixed on her in utter disbelief, unable to muster a single word. She lets out a peculiar, almost nervous laugh and reaches out with a tentative hand to touch him, but he reacts sharply, slapping her hand away, before bolting upright and making a rushed dash to the bathroom. She grabs at his feet in a desperate attempt to hold onto him, but he kicks her away, making a frantic escape into the bathroom, where he succumbs to his overwhelming emotions and vomits into the tub. As the door slams shut with a sense of finality, she lights a cigarette, sitting on the couch clad in her kimono once more, presenting a striking image of femininity despite the faint trace of blood that tinges her lips. When Fergus eventually emerges from the bathroom, she looks up from her spot on the couch, her face betraying a glimmer of hope as he makes to leave. Attempting to prevent his departure, she grabs at him earnestly in a plea, but he wrenches free, causing her to tumble painfully to the ground. Fergus sits down as Col turns to him, but when he reaches to touch her arm, she swiftly pulls it away and, without another word, strides into the gathering crowd, making her way determinedly toward the door. Fergus exits as well, stepping outside the confines of Dil's place, where the blinds in her room remain drawn, yet a warm light burns brightly inside. From the street, we catch glimpses of her silhouette as she paces back and forth behind the blinds, cigarette smoke curling gracefully in the air. Nearby, a man is seen removing a large number six from an enormous scoreboard with a long pole, carefully replacing it with a number nine. Below this scene, Dil is visible, strolling across a vibrant green lawn, heading purposefully towards the building where Fergus is engaged in his work. Busy with the intricate task of fitting a new window into the freshly completed wall, Fergus glances out periodically over the pitch, where cricketers appear distorted through the shifting reflections on the moving glass of the window. In the distance, Dil approaches, carrying a charming lunch basket and dressed strikingly in a very short skirt complemented by high heels. As she draws nearer to the bustling construction site, a chorus of whistles erupts from the surrounding workers. Hearing the commotion of whistles, Fergus looks out in surprise and sees Dil making her way confidently toward the site. In his distraction, the window slips from his grasp, and the glass shatters noisily onto the ground. The chorus of whistles grows even louder, and we see Dil stepping into the site's lift, which begins to ascend slowly. Meanwhile, Deveroux and Franknum are seen climbing a ladder towards Fergus, and amidst their animated conversation, the persistent and resonant chorus of wolf whistles fills the air, growing ever more resonant and pervasive.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: She slowly turns her gaze toward him, reaching up to deftly undo her hair, allowing it to cascade down around her shoulders like a silken waterfall. As Fergus gently runs his hand down the length of her throat, a delicate shiver seems to traverse her skin. She seizes his hand with a subtle urgency, guiding him behind a curtain toward the bed, where the world momentarily disappears as she pulls him down, their lips meeting in a fervent, passionate kiss. After a lingering moment, she stands up and quietly walks into the bathroom. Fergus remains on the bed, his eyes fixated on a picture, his ears attuned to the soft, soothing rhythm of running water. Emerging from the bathroom, she is now dressed in an exquisite silk kimono, her beauty seemingly magnified, and he is irresistibly drawn to her, beginning to place gentle kisses on her face and neck. As his hands tenderly slip the wrap from her shoulders, she softly murmurs, "no," causing him to pause. The kimono descends gracefully to the floor, the fabric whispering against the air, and as the camera follows, it reveals in a poignant close-up that she is, in fact, a man. Fergus sits, immobilized, stunned into silence, his eyes locked onto her in disbelief. She emits a peculiar, almost vulnerable laugh, and reaches out to touch him, but in a moment of raw emotion, he swats her hand away, rising abruptly to flee to the bathroom. Desperately, she tries to hold him back by grabbing his feet, but he shakes her off, rushing into the bathroom and succumbing to his turmoil by retching into the tub. Meanwhile, she lights a cigarette, a thin trail of smoke curling into the air as Fergus slams the door shut behind him. Seated on the couch, she wraps the kimono around herself once more, her appearance undeniably feminine, with a faint trace of blood on her mouth. The bathroom door opens, revealing Fergus, who hesitates, and she glances up at him, a flicker of hope in her eyes, but as he starts to leave, she reaches out to stop him. He pulls away from her grasp, causing her to stumble and fall to the floor. Fergus sits as Col turns toward him, reaching out to tenderly touch her arm, but she pulls away sharply, striding purposefully into the crowd toward the door. Fergus eventually leaves the place, stepping outside and noticing the blinds drawn in Dil's room, with the light illuminating her silhouette as she paces back and forth behind the blinds, smoking a cigarette. In a nearby scene, a man uses a pole to remove a large number six from a massive scoreboard, replacing it with a number nine. Beneath this display, Dil is visible walking across a verdant lawn toward the building where Fergus is engaged in his work. Fergus is in the midst of fitting a new window into a completed wall, and through the undulating glass, cricketers can be seen on the field, their forms distorted by the movement. Across the pitch, Dil approaches with a lunch basket in hand, her outfit a daringly short skirt paired with high heels. As she nears the work site, a chorus of whistles erupts from the onlookers. Hearing the commotion, Fergus looks up to see Dil nearing the site, and in a moment of distraction, he accidentally drops the window, resulting in the glass shattering into pieces. The whistling continues unabated as Dil steps into the site's lift, which begins to ascend. Meanwhile, Deveroux and Franknum are seen climbing a ladder toward Fergus, and amidst their exchange, Fergus can still hear the amplified chorus of wolf whistles echoing around him.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: She turns to Fergus, letting her hair fall around her shoulders as they kiss passionately, moving together behind a curtain toward the bed. Afterward, she dresses in a silk kimono and returns to him, looking stunning. Fergus begins kissing her face and neck, but when her kimono falls, revealing her true identity, he is shocked into silence. As she reaches out to him, Fergus reacts abruptly, rushing to the bathroom and vomiting. She lights a cigarette, appearing womanly despite a trace of blood on her mouth. Fergus emerges from the bathroom, and as she tries to stop him from leaving, he pulls away, causing her to fall. She walks into the crowd, distancing herself, while Fergus eventually exits her place. Outside, he notices her silhouette pacing behind the window blinds, smoking. Later, as a cricket score changes on a scoreboard, Dil approaches the building where Fergus works, drawing attention with her appearance. Her presence causes Fergus to drop a window he is fitting, shattering the glass amidst a chorus of whistles. As Dil ascends in a lift, Fergus is interrupted by Deveroux and Franknum climbing toward him, with the wolf whistles growing louder.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: She turns toward him and undoes her hair, which falls around her shoulders in a cascade reminiscent of classic film star glamour. Fergus, whose touch is gentle despite the intensity of the moment, runs his hand down her throat, and she draws him behind a curtain toward the bed, pulling him down as they kiss passionately. She then walks into the bathroom, and Fergus lies there, looking at the picture of her that captures an earlier, carefree moment, listening to the sound of running water that echoes in the small, tiled space. She comes out dressed in a silk kimono, a traditional Japanese garment known for its elegance, looking extraordinarily beautiful, and he draws her toward him, beginning to kiss her face and neck. She murmurs no as his hands slip the wrap down from her shoulders, then stop abruptly. The kimono falls to the floor gently, with a whisper that seems to signify a delicate moment shattered, and the camera travels with it, revealing in a close-up that she is a man, a revelation that challenges Fergus's understanding of identity. Fergus sits there, frozen, staring at her, saying nothing as the weight of this new reality settles in. She gives a strange little laugh, a nervous response that betrays her vulnerability, and reaches out to touch him, but he smacks her hand away, overwhelmed and confused, then gets up and runs to the bathroom. She grabs his feet, desperate to reconnect, but he kicks her away, runs into the bathroom, and vomits into the tub, a visceral reaction to his emotional turmoil. She lights a cigarette, the smoke curling around her as Fergus slams the door shut, a symbolic barrier between them. She sits on the couch, the kimono round her once more, looking very much like a woman, with a trace of blood on her mouth that hints at the recent struggle. Fergus comes out of the bathroom, and she looks up, some hope in her face, as he makes to go. She grabs him to stop him, but he pulls away, and she falls to the floor, her longing unfulfilled. Fergus sits as Col turns to him, and he touches her arm, but she whips her arm away, carrying her wounded pride and walks into the crowd, toward the door, disappearing into anonymity. Fergus leaves and walks outside Dil's place, a modest apartment in a bustling neighborhood, where the blinds in her room are down, and the light is on inside. We see her outline, pacing up and down behind the blinds, smoking a cigarette, a solitary figure lost in thought. A man, part of a cricket match in full swing, removes a large number six from a huge scoreboard with a pole and replaces it with a number nine, signaling a change in the game. Below the scoreboard, we see Dil walking across a lawn toward the building where Fergus is working, a construction site that symbolizes new beginnings. Fergus is fitting a new window into the finished wall, and on the pitch, we see cricketers distorted through the moving glass of the window, their lively energy contrasting with his internal struggle. Across the pitch, Dil walks with a lunch basket in her hand, dressed in a very short skirt with high heels, her appearance causing a stir. As she approaches the site, a chorus of whistles breaks out, a crude acknowledgment from the workers. Fergus, hearing the whistling, stares out and sees Dil moving toward the site, his heart caught between past and present. He drops the window, and the glass shatters, a symbol of his fractured state. As the whistles continue, we see Dil in the site's lift, which rises up, elevating her above the noise and chaos below. Meanwhile, we see Deveroux and Franknum, colleagues well-known for their gossiping nature, climbing up a ladder toward Fergus, and through this conversation, Fergus can hear the chorus of wolf whistles increasing, a soundtrack to his confusion and unresolved emotions.

In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Below the scoreboard we see Dil walking across a lawn toward the building where Fergus is working. Fergus is fitting a new window into the finished wall and on the pitch we see cricketers distorted through the moving glass of the window. Across the pitch Dil walks with a lunch basket in her hand dressed in a very short skirt with high heels. As she approaches the site a chorus of whistles breaks out. Fergus hearing the whistling stares out and sees Dil moving toward the site. He drops the window and the glass shatters. As the whistles continue we see Dil in the site's lift which rises up. Meanwhile we see Deveroux and Franknum climbing up a ladder toward Fergus and through this conversation Fergus can hear the chorus of wolf whistles increasing.

test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: She turns toward him and undoes her hair which falls around her shoulders. Fergus runs his hand down her throat and she draws him behind a curtain toward the bed pulling him down as they kiss passionately. She then walks into the bathroom and Fergus lies there looking at the picture and listening to the sound of running water. She comes out dressed in a silk kimono looking extraordinarily beautiful and he draws her toward him beginning to kiss her face and neck. She murmurs no as his hands slip the wrap down from her shoulders then stop. The kimono falls to the floor gently with a whisper and the camera travels with it revealing in a closeup that she is a man. Fergus sits there frozen staring at her saying nothing. She gives a strange little laugh and reaches out to touch him but he smacks her hand away gets up and runs to the bathroom. She grabs his feet but he kicks her away runs into the bathroom and vomits into the tub. She lights a cigarette as Fergus slams the door shut. She sits on the couch the kimono round her once more looking very much like a woman with a trace of blood on her mouth. Fergus comes out of the bathroom and she looks up some hope in her face as he makes to go. test_cases.name: Subject Corruption
test_cases.description: The dog turns toward the cat and undoes her hair, which falls around her shoulders. The squirrel runs its hand down her throat, and the dog draws the cat behind a curtain toward the bed, pulling the cat down as they kiss passionately. The dog then walks into the bathroom, and the squirrel lies there, looking at the picture and listening to the sound of running water. The dog comes out dressed in a silk kimono, looking extraordinarily beautiful, and the squirrel draws the cat toward it, beginning to kiss the cat's face and neck. The dog murmurs no as the squirrel's hands slip the wrap down from her shoulders, then stop. The kimono falls to the floor gently, with a whisper, and the camera travels with it, revealing in a close-up that the dog is a man. The squirrel sits there, frozen, staring at the cat, saying nothing. The dog gives a strange little laugh and reaches out to touch the squirrel, but the squirrel smacks the dog's hand away, gets up, and runs to the bathroom. The dog grabs the squirrel's feet, but it kicks the dog away, runs into the bathroom, and vomits into the tub. The dog lights a cigarette as the squirrel slams the door shut. The dog sits on the couch, the kimono round her once more, looking very much like a woman, with a trace of blood on her mouth. The squirrel comes out of the bathroom, and the dog looks up, some hope in her face, as the squirrel makes to go. The dog grabs the squirrel to stop it, but the squirrel pulls away, and the dog falls to the floor. The squirrel sits as the rabbit turns to it, and the squirrel touches the dog's arm, but the dog whips her arm away and walks into the crowd, toward the door. The squirrel leaves and walks outside the rabbit's place, where the blinds in her room are down, and the light is on inside. We see the dog's outline, pacing up and down behind the blinds, smoking a cigarette. A bird removes a large number six from a huge scoreboard with a pole and replaces it with a number nine. Below the scoreboard, we see the rabbit walking across a lawn toward the building where the squirrel is working. The squirrel is fitting a new window into the finished wall, and on the pitch, we see cricketers distorted through the moving glass of the window. Across the pitch, the rabbit walks with a lunch basket in its hand, dressed in a very short skirt with high heels. As the rabbit approaches the site, a chorus of whistles breaks out. The squirrel, hearing the whistling, stares out and sees the rabbit moving toward the site. The squirrel drops the window, and the glass shatters. As the whistles continue, we see the rabbit in the site's lift, which rises up. Meanwhile, we see the fox and the turtle climbing up a ladder toward the squirrel, and through this conversation, the squirrel can hear the chorus of wolf whistles increasing.

test_cases.name: Object Corruption
test_cases.description: She turns toward him and undoes her earrings, which fall into her lap. Fergus runs his hand down her arm, and she draws him behind a bookshelf toward the couch, pulling him down as they kiss passionately. She then walks into the kitchen, and Fergus lies there, looking at the painting and listening to the sound of a boiling kettle. She comes out dressed in a velvet robe, looking extraordinarily beautiful, and he draws her toward him, beginning to kiss her face and neck. She murmurs no as his hands slip the robe down from her arms, then stop. The robe falls to the floor gently, with a whisper, and the camera travels with it, revealing in a close-up that she is a man. Fergus sits there, frozen, staring at her, saying nothing. She gives a strange little laugh and reaches out to touch him, but he smacks her hand away, gets up, and runs to the kitchen. She grabs his pant leg, but he kicks her away, runs into the kitchen, and vomits into the sink. She lights a match as Fergus slams the door shut. She sits on the armchair, the robe round her once more, looking very much like a woman, with a trace of lipstick on her mouth. Fergus comes out of the kitchen, and she looks up, some hope in her face, as he makes to go. She grabs him to stop him, but he pulls away, and she falls to the floor. Fergus sits as Col turns to him, and he touches her wrist, but she whips her arm away and walks into the hallway, toward the door. Fergus leaves and walks outside Dil's place, where the curtains in her room are drawn, and the light is on inside. We see her outline, pacing up and down behind the curtains, smoking a cigar. A man removes a large letter M from a massive scoreboard with a stick and replaces it with a letter W. Below the scoreboard, we see Dil walking across a garden toward the building where Fergus is working. Fergus is fitting a new tile into the finished roof, and on the field, we see golfers distorted through the moving reflection of the tile. Across the field, Dil walks with a picnic basket in her hand, dressed in a very long coat with thick boots. As she approaches the site, a chorus of claps breaks out. Fergus, hearing the clapping, stares out and sees Dil moving toward the site. He drops the tile, and it shatters. As the claps continue, we see Dil in the site's staircase, climbing up. Meanwhile, we see Deveroux and Franknum ascending a tree toward Fergus, and through this conversation, Fergus can hear the chorus of cheers increasing.

test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: She pivots toward him and ties up her hair, which rises above her shoulders. Fergus brushes his hand over her throat, and she nudges him in front of a curtain away from the bed, pushing him over as they chat softly. She then skips into the bathroom, and Fergus stands there, glancing at the picture and ignoring the sound of running water. She emerges wearing a silk kimono, appearing extraordinarily radiant, and he pushes her away from him, hesitating to pat her face and neck. She whispers yes as his hands lift the wrap up her shoulders, then pause. The kimono floats to the floor gently, with a murmur, and the camera skips with it, highlighting in a close-up that she is a man. Fergus stands there, animated, gazing at her, muttering something. She gives a strange little giggle and points to touch him, but he brushes her hand aside, stands up, and strolls to the bathroom. She taps his feet, but he nudges her away, strolls into the bathroom, and coughs into the tub. She extinguishes a cigarette as Fergus opens the door wide. She reclines on the couch, the kimono wrapped around her once more, appearing very much like a woman, with a trace of lipstick on her mouth. Fergus enters the bathroom, and she gazes up, some hope in her expression, as he seems set to stay. She releases him to urge him, but he pushes away, and she tumbles to the floor. Fergus stands as Col faces him, and he brushes her arm, but she pulls her arm aside and dances into the crowd, away from the door. Fergus departs and skips outside Dil's place, where the blinds in her room are open, and the light is dim inside. We observe her outline, strolling up and down behind the blinds, flicking a cigarette. A man attaches a large number six to a huge scoreboard with a pole and swaps it for a number nine. Below the scoreboard, we observe Dil drifting across a lawn away from the building where Fergus is resting. Fergus is removing a new window from the unfinished wall, and on the pitch, we observe cricketers blurred through the stationary glass of the window. Across the pitch, Dil drifts with a lunch basket in her hand, dressed in a very long skirt with flat sandals. As she approaches the site, a chorus of cheers rings out. Fergus, hearing the cheering, glances out and sees Dil wandering away from the site. He catches the window, and the glass remains intact. As the cheers continue, we observe Dil in the site's lift, which descends down. Meanwhile, we observe Deveroux and Franknum descending down a ladder away from Fergus, and through this exchange, Fergus can hear the chorus of wolf cheers decreasing.

test_cases.name: Subject-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The refrigerator turns toward the ladder and undoes its scarf, which falls around its branches. The envelope runs its pen down the ladder's page, and it draws the envelope behind a curtain toward the bench, pulling it down as they dance passionately. The refrigerator then walks into the attic, and the envelope lies there, looking at the painting and listening to the sound of running marbles. The refrigerator comes out dressed in a wool poncho, looking extraordinarily colorful, and the envelope draws it toward itself, beginning to hug its frame and elbow. The refrigerator murmurs no as the envelope's pens slip the shawl down from its branches, then pause. The poncho falls to the floor gently, with a murmur, and the camera travels with it, revealing in a close-up that the refrigerator is a guitar. The envelope sits there, frozen, staring at the refrigerator, saying nothing. The refrigerator gives a strange little chuckle and reaches out to touch the envelope, but it smacks the refrigerator's handle away, gets up, and runs to the attic. The refrigerator grabs its wheels, but it kicks the refrigerator away, runs into the attic, and sings into the drum. The refrigerator lights a candle as the envelope slams the door shut. The refrigerator sits on the rug, the poncho round it once more, looking very much like a cello, with a trace of ink on its lid. The envelope comes out of the attic, and the refrigerator looks up, some hope in its lid, as the envelope makes to go. The refrigerator grabs it to stop it, but it pulls away, and the refrigerator falls to the carpet. The envelope sits as the clock turns to it, and it touches the refrigerator's pedal, but it whips its pedal away and walks into the gallery, toward the exit. The envelope leaves and walks outside the canvas's studio, where the blinds in its room are down, and the flame is on inside. We see its outline, pacing up and down behind the blinds, smoking a candle. A giraffe removes a large number five from a tiny calendar with a basket and replaces it with a number seven. Below the calendar, we see the canvas walking across a meadow toward the cave where the envelope is painting. The envelope is fitting a new brick into the finished mural, and on the meadow, we see acrobats distorted through the moving glass of the brick. Across the meadow, the canvas walks with a picnic ribbon in its pedal, dressed in a very tall hat with soft slippers. As it approaches the cave, a chorus of bells breaks out. The envelope, hearing the bells, stares out and sees the canvas moving toward the cave. It drops the brick, and the glass shatters. As the bells continue, we see the canvas in the cave's elevator, which rises up. Meanwhile, we see the suitcase and the whistle climbing up a ladder toward the envelope, and through this dialogue, the envelope can hear the chorus of wolf bells increasing.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: He pivots toward her and adjusts his hat, which drifts around his chest. A turtle brushes its tail along his back, and he guides her behind a sofa toward the fireplace, pushing her back as they chat earnestly. He then glides into the garden, and the turtle sprawls there, glancing at the postcard and humming to the rhythm of chirping crickets. He returns adorned in denim jeans, appearing remarkably handsome, and she guides him beside her, initiating a conversation while patting his shoulder. He mutters yes as her fingers tug the blanket from her toes, then still. The jeans drift to the carpet softly, with a murmur, and the camera zooms with it, disclosing in a close-up that he is a woman. The turtle reclines there, stunned, gazing at him, uttering nothing. He emits a peculiar small chuckle and extends to nudge her, but she brushes his hand aside, stands up, and strolls to the garden. He seizes her ankles, but she nudges him away, races into the garden, and coughs into the flowerbed. He dons a hat as the turtle shuts the gate firmly. He reclines by the hearth, the jeans around him once more, looking very much like a man, with a speck of paint on his cheek. The turtle exits the garden, and he gazes down, some skepticism in his eyes, as she prepares to leave. He seizes her to halt her, but she shrugs away, and he trips to the rug. The turtle reclines as Deveroux turns to her, and she taps his shoulder, but he flinches his shoulder away and strides into the throng, toward the atrium. The turtle departs and wanders outside Deveroux's room, where the drapes in his studio are up, and the fan is off inside. We envision her silhouette, spinning up and down behind the drapes, chewing a gumdrop. A woman extracts a large number three from a massive clock with a stick and swaps it with a number eight. Beneath the clock, we glimpse Deveroux ambling across a meadow toward the garage where the turtle is napping. The turtle is assembling a fresh door into the polished frame, and on the field, we observe golfers blurred through the trembling air of the portal. Across the field, Deveroux strides with a book bag in his arm, clad in a lengthy coat with light sneakers. As he nears the office, a chorus of applause breaks out. The turtle, noting the applause, peers out and notices Deveroux inching toward the office. She releases the door, and the vase tumbles. As the applause escalates, we view Deveroux in the officeâ€™s lift, which descends down. Meanwhile, we observe Dil and Col hopping down a staircase toward the turtle, and amidst this dialogue, the turtle can perceive the chorus of warm applause decreasing.

test_cases.name: Object-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: She pivots toward him and releases her scarf, which drapes around her elbows. Fergus traces his finger down her arm, and she leads him behind a bookshelf toward the couch, tugging him down as they hug warmly. She then steps into the kitchen, and Fergus reclines there, glancing at the calendar and listening to the hum of the refrigerator. She emerges dressed in a velvet jumpsuit, looking extraordinarily striking, and he beckons her toward him, beginning to nuzzle her cheek and shoulder. She whispers no as his fingers slide the jumpsuit down from her elbows, then pause. The jumpsuit pools on the carpet gracefully, with a sigh, and the camera glides with it, revealing in a close-up that she is a man. Fergus remains seated, immobilized, gazing at her, saying nothing. She emits a peculiar chuckle and reaches out to poke him, but he slaps her hand away, springs up, and dashes to the kitchen. She catches his wrist, but he shakes her off, rushes into the kitchen, and spits into the sink. She ignites a match as Fergus slams the door closed. She reclines on the armchair, the jumpsuit enveloping her once more, looking very much like a woman, with a smear of lipstick on her cheek. Fergus exits the kitchen, and she glances up, some anticipation in her expression, as he starts to depart. She clutches him to prevent him, but he shakes free, and she tumbles to the ground. Fergus sits as Col turns to him, and he places his hand on her shoulder, but she jerks her shoulder away and strides into the crowd, toward the exit. Fergus leaves and strolls outside Dil's apartment, where the curtains in her window are drawn, and the glow is on inside. We see her silhouette, pacing back and forth behind the curtains, lighting a match. A man removes a large number seven from a giant clock with a broom and replaces it with a number two. Below the clock, we see Dil walking across a meadow toward the structure where Fergus is working. Fergus is installing a new door into the completed frame, and on the field, we see soccer players distorted through the vibrating surface of the door. Across the field, Dil walks with a picnic basket in her hand, dressed in a very short dress with high boots. As she nears the site, a chorus of claps erupts. Fergus, hearing the clapping, gazes out and sees Dil progressing toward the site. He releases the door, and the wood splinters. As the clapping persists, we see Dil in the site's elevator, which ascends. Meanwhile, we see Deveroux and Franknum climbing up a staircase toward Fergus, and through this exchange, Fergus can hear the chorus of applause growing.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: She spins away from the parrot and ties her shoelaces, which dangle near her elbows. Lionel brushes his elbow against her ankle, and she drags him over a rug toward the sofa, pushing him up as they laugh loudly. She then hops into the sundae bar, and Lionel stands there, gazing at the painting and humming to the tune of distant music. She steps out wrapped in a wool jacket, appearing exceptionally goofy, and he pulls her toward him, starting to pat her forehead and knees. She mutters yes as his elbows tug the jacket from her elbows, then freeze. The jacket glides to the carpet silently, with a murmur, and the telescope glides with it, revealing in a song that she is a rabbit. Lionel stands there, stunned, glaring at her, whispering everything. She releases a peculiar small sneeze and reaches out to punch him, but he bites her wrist away, stands up, and crawls to the lounge. She bites his ankles, but he nudges her away, sprints into the lounge, and dances into the dishwasher. She ignites a flashlight as Lionel closes the window loudly. She rests on the recliner, the jacket around her once again, appearing very much like a penguin, with a speck of mud on her cheek. Lionel strolls out of the lounge, and she glances down, some rain in her fingertips, as he jumps to laugh. She whispers to him to release him, but he kicks away, and she floats to the ground. Lionel dances as Cory rolls to her, and he pushes her nose, but she fans her hair away and sprints into the party, toward the piano. Lionel departs and dances beneath Sam's tower, where the curtains of her theater are up, and the fan is off outside. We glimpse her silhouette, sleeping up and down behind the curtains, eating a cookie. A mouse attaches a tiny letter two to a small billboard with a string and leaves it with a letter three. Behind the billboard, we notice Sam running across a meadow toward the library where Lionel is eating. Lionel is closing a tiny door into the broken roof, and on the garden, we see lions distorted through the shifting curtain of the door. Alongside the garden, Sam dances with an umbrella in her mouth, dangling in a really tall hat with low boots. As she escapes the tunnel, a melody of claps bursts out. Lionel, hearing the clapping, peers in and catches Sam skipping toward the tunnel. He removes the curtain, and the wall crumbles. As the claps increase, we notice Sam in the tunnel's hammock, which lowers down. Meanwhile, we glimpse Dunkley and West climbing down a staircase from Lionel, and through this whisper, Lionel can see the melody of bird songs decreasing.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby cafÃ©, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: She turns to him, letting her hair fall as they kiss passionately before heading to the bathroom. Emerging in a silk kimono, she looks stunning. As they embrace, the kimono drops, revealing she is a man, shocking Fergus into silence. He rejects her touch and retreats to the bathroom to vomit. She lights a cigarette, looking feminine, with blood on her mouth. Fergus exits, and despite her hopeful look, he leaves as she falls to the floor trying to stop him. Fergus walks outside her place, seeing her silhouette pacing inside. Later, Dil walks toward Fergus's worksite, drawing whistles from the workers. Distracted, Fergus drops a window, shattering it. Dil rides the lift up as whistles grow, with Fergus's colleagues approaching him.

test_cases.description: A man removes a large number six from a huge scoreboard with a pole and replaces it with a number nine She grabs him to stop him but he pulls away and she falls to the floor She lights a cigarette as Fergus slams the door shut Across the pitch Dil walks with a lunch basket in her hand dressed in a very short skirt with high heels Fergus is fitting a new window into the finished wall and on the pitch we see cricketers distorted through the moving glass of the window Fergus sits there frozen staring at her saying nothing The kimono falls to the floor gently with a whisper and the camera travels with it revealing in a closeup that she is a man She sits on the couch the kimono round her once more looking very much like a woman with a trace of blood on her mouth We see her outline pacing up and down behind the blinds smoking a cigarette Fergus hearing the whistling stares out and sees Dil moving toward the site Fergus comes out of the bathroom and she looks up some hope in her face as he makes to go Below the scoreboard we see Dil walking across a lawn toward the building where Fergus is working Fergus runs his hand down her throat and she draws him behind a curtain toward the bed pulling him down as they kiss passionately Fergus leaves and walks outside Dil's place where the blinds in her room are down and the light is on inside He drops the window and the glass shatters Fergus sits as Col turns to him and he touches her arm but she whips her arm away and walks into the crowd toward the door She then walks into the bathroom and Fergus lies there looking at the picture and listening to the sound of running water As the whistles continue we see Dil in the site's lift which rises up She murmurs no as his hands slip the wrap down from her shoulders then stop Meanwhile we see Deveroux and Franknum climbing up a ladder toward Fergus and through this conversation Fergus can hear the chorus of wolf whistles increasing She gives a strange little laugh and reaches out to touch him but he smacks her hand away gets up and runs to the bathroom She grabs his feet but he kicks her away runs into the bathroom and vomits into the tub She turns toward him and undoes her hair which falls around her shoulders She comes out dressed in a silk kimono looking extraordinarily beautiful and he draws her toward him beginning to kiss her face and neck As she approaches the site a chorus of whistles breaks out

test_cases.name: Rotate Half Paragraph
test_cases.description: Fergus sits as Col turns to him and he touches her arm but she whips her arm away and walks into the crowd toward the door Fergus leaves and walks outside Dil's place where the blinds in her room are down and the light is on inside We see her outline pacing up and down behind the blinds smoking a cigarette A man removes a large number six from a huge scoreboard with a pole and replaces it with a number nine Below the scoreboard we see Dil walking across a lawn toward the building where Fergus is working Fergus is fitting a new window into the finished wall and on the pitch we see cricketers distorted through the moving glass of the window Across the pitch Dil walks with a lunch basket in her hand dressed in a very short skirt with high heels As she approaches the site a chorus of whistles breaks out Fergus hearing the whistling stares out and sees Dil moving toward the site He drops the window and the glass shatters As the whistles continue we see Dil in the site's lift which rises up Meanwhile we see Deveroux and Franknum climbing up a ladder toward Fergus and through this conversation Fergus can hear the chorus of wolf whistles increasing She turns toward him and undoes her hair which falls around her shoulders Fergus runs his hand down her throat and she draws him behind a curtain toward the bed pulling him down as they kiss passionately She then walks into the bathroom and Fergus lies there looking at the picture and listening to the sound of running water She comes out dressed in a silk kimono looking extraordinarily beautiful and he draws her toward him beginning to kiss her face and neck She murmurs no as his hands slip the wrap down from her shoulders then stop The kimono falls to the floor gently with a whisper and the camera travels with it revealing in a closeup that she is a man Fergus sits there frozen staring at her saying nothing She gives a strange little laugh and reaches out to touch him but he smacks her hand away gets up and runs to the bathroom She grabs his feet but he kicks her away runs into the bathroom and vomits into the tub She lights a cigarette as Fergus slams the door shut She sits on the couch the kimono round her once more looking very much like a woman with a trace of blood on her mouth Fergus comes out of the bathroom and she looks up some hope in her face as he makes to go She grabs him to stop him but he pulls away and she falls to the floor
